content: Former constituency in SingaporeThis article includes a list of general references, but **it lacks sufficient corresponding inline citations**. Please help to improve this article by introducing more precise citations. *(March 2025)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Delta Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore from 1959 to 1988. It was originally part of [Havelock Constituency](/wiki/Havelock_Constituency). ## History In 1988, the constituency was dissolved following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and [Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC). ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member****Party****Formation**[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1959**[Chan Choy Siong](/wiki/Chan_Choy_Siong)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**Chan Choy Siong[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972**Yeo Choo Kok**1976****1980****1984****Constituency abolished (1988)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election 1959](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election): Delta PartyCandidateVotes%±%[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Chan Choy Siong](/wiki/Chan_Choy_Siong)9,30169.45[LSP](/wiki/Liberal_Socialist_Party)Lim Ah Lee2,30817.23[MCA](/wiki/Malayan_Chinese_Association)Chia Chee Buang1,2129.05[SPA](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Alliance)N.
